title: Sin
data:
**Sin**, represented overall by the character 7, is a [defunct](/wiki/Defunct_features_\(SpliceHack\) "Defunct features (SpliceHack)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") that encompassed the Seven Deadly Sins. They were removed on or before SpliceHack 1.0.0.

All sins were [unique](/wiki/Unique_monster "Unique monster") and only encountered in the [endgame](/wiki/Endgame "Endgame"). Each of the [planes](/wiki/Elemental_planes "Elemental planes") contained one of the seven sins, determined randomly, at a random location. Fighting them was optional, and it was generally preferable to avoid them, due to their high level and exceedingly nasty attacks.

All of the sins were capable of following the player through [portals](/wiki/Portal "Portal").

[ ]

- [2 Sloth](#Sloth)
- [3 Pride](#Pride)
- [4 Greed](#Greed)

- [6 Gluttony](#Gluttony)
- [7 Envy](#Envy)

| Wrath:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim").
* can [tunnel](/wiki/Tunnel "Tunnel") through walls.
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [regenerates HP quickly](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [lord to its kind](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD").
* is male.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can throw boulders.
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                                   |

**Wrath** was a dangerous physical combatant with a high damage output. He was [fast](/wiki/Fast "Fast"), able to [jump](/wiki/Jump "Jump"), and could hit the player from two squares away using his spiked chain. Due to his high speed and varied forms of movement, Wrath was one of the sins it is more likely for the player to encounter.

Wrath was generated with the following items:

- 20 [knives](/wiki/Knife "Knife")
- Plate mail
- Spiked chain. This spiked chain is made of whatever material the player's [race](/wiki/Race "Race") is vulnerable to, if any.

**Sloth** was slow and easy to avoid, but very difficult to destroy and potentially deadly when fought in melee. Sloth had regeneration and [revived](/wiki/Revive "Revive") from its corpse.

* is neither male nor female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* wants the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"). |                                                                                                                                                                       |

**Envy** was the most frequently encountered of the sins, and potentially the most annoying for the player. Their multiple intrinsic-stealing attacks could deprive players of crucial resistances during the endgame, and their [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") nature made them almost impossible to avoid. Unlike the other sins, Envy is not immune to [petrification](/wiki/Petrification "Petrification").
html:
Sin

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Sin, represented overall by the character 7, is a defunct monster class in SpliceHack that encompassed the Seven Deadly Sins. They were removed on or before SpliceHack 1.0.0.

All sins were unique and only encountered in the endgame. Each of the planes contained one of the seven sins, determined randomly, at a random location. Fighting them was optional, and it was generally preferable to avoid them, due to their high level and exceedingly nasty attacks.

All of the sins were capable of following the player through portals.

Contents

  • 1 Wrath
  • 2 Sloth
  • 3 Pride
  • 4 Greed
  • 5 Lust
  • 6 Gluttony
  • 7 Envy

Wrath

7 Wrath
Difficulty 77
Attacks Weapon 4d4, Weapon 4d4, Weapon 4d4, Spell-casting 2d6 magic missile
7 Wrath
Difficulty 77
Attacks

Weapon 4d4, Weapon 4d4, Weapon 4d4, Spell-casting 2d6 magic missile

Base level 35
Base experience 1647
Speed 18
Base AC −7
Base MR 80
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances poison, fire, cold, shock, petrification, magic
Resistances conveyed poison (25%), fire (25%), electricity (25%), cold (25%)

Wrath:

  • can fly.
  • can swim.
  • can tunnel through walls.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a lord to its kind.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can throw boulders.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • has infravision.

Wrath was a dangerous physical combatant with a high damage output. He was fast, able to jump, and could hit the player from two squares away using his spiked chain. Due to his high speed and varied forms of movement, Wrath was one of the sins it is more likely for the player to encounter.

Wrath was generated with the following items:

  • 20 knives
  • Plate mail
  • Spiked chain. This spiked chain is made of whatever material the player's race is vulnerable to, if any.

  • has infravision.

Sloth was slow and easy to avoid, but very difficult to destroy and potentially deadly when fought in melee. Sloth had regeneration and revived from its corpse.

Pride was unsolid and would phase through walls to approach the player. Their psychic attack could potentially confuse their target.

  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • has infravision.

Gluttony had a potentially deadly digestion attack and could inflict hunger on the player.

Envy

7 Envy
Difficulty 77
Attacks Claw 4d10 intrinsic-stealing, Claw 4d10 intrinsic-stealing, Touch drowning
7 Envy
Difficulty 77
Attacks

Claw 4d10 intrinsic-stealing, Claw 4d10 intrinsic-stealing, Touch drowning

Base level 35
Base experience 1730
Speed 15
Base AC −7
Base MR 70
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances fire, cold, poison, disintegration, psychic, sonic, level drain
Resistances conveyed disintegration (25%), poison (25%), fire (25%), cold (25%), Cures stoning

Envy:

  • can fly.
  • can swim.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • has a serpent body.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • is acidic to eat.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • wants the Amulet of Yendor.

Envy was the most frequently encountered of the sins, and potentially the most annoying for the player. Their multiple intrinsic-stealing attacks could deprive players of crucial resistances during the endgame, and their covetous nature made them almost impossible to avoid. Unlike the other sins, Envy is not immune to petrification.

rawPage:
'''Sin''', represented overall by the character {{white|7}}, is a [[defunct features (SpliceHack)|defunct]] [[monster class]] in [[SpliceHack]] that encompassed the Seven Deadly Sins. They were removed on or before SpliceHack 1.0.0.

All sins were [[unique monster|unique]] and only encountered in the [[endgame]]. Each of the [[Elemental planes|planes]] contained one of the seven sins, determined randomly, at a random location. Fighting them was optional, and it was generally preferable to avoid them, due to their high level and exceedingly nasty attacks.

All of the sins were capable of following the player through [[portal]]s.

== Wrath ==

 |resistances=poison, fire, cold, shock, petrification, magic
 |attributes={{attributes|Wrath|fly=1|swim=1|humanoid=1|regen=1|see_invis=1|carnivore=1|tunnel=1|jumper=1|lord=1|male=1|hostile=1|stalk=1|strong=1|rockthrow=1|collect=1|magic=1|pname=1|nopoly=1|nasty=1|infravision=1|mh_angel=1}}
 |size=Medium

 |weight=1450

'''Wrath''' was a dangerous physical combatant with a high damage output. He was [[fast]], able to [[jump]], and could hit the player from two squares away using his spiked chain. Due to his high speed and varied forms of movement, Wrath was one of the sins it is more likely for the player to encounter.

Wrath was generated with the following items:

* 20 [[knife|knives]]
* Plate mail
* Spiked chain. This spiked chain is made of whatever material the player's [[race]] is vulnerable to, if any.
{{clear}}
